thread.title: Apple MacBook Pro: Top 8 deals and how to buy refurbished
thread.title_full: Apple MacBook Pro: Top 8 deals and how to buy refurbished - Mirror Online

author: Emma Munbodh
title: Apple MacBook Pro: Top 8 deals and how to buy refurbished
text:
Shopping for a new laptop? The Apple MacBook Pro is one of the most advanced netbooks on the market - but, it comes with a price tag to match.
The Pro launched in the UK in 2006, and is the heavier version of the MacBook Air , with a built-in CD/DVD drive and a £150 greater price tag.
What's the difference between the Pro and Air? The Apple MacBook Pro boasts a more powerful processor thanks to its size, as well as faster speeds and a bigger hard drive - we show you how to buy one for less below.
Where can I buy the MacBook Pro? Most high street retailers stock the MacBook Pro, the most popular being Currys , Argos , Amazon , John Lewis and of course the Apple store . You can also find some amazing deals on eBay auctions.
How much does it cost? RRP prices vary from £899 to £1,999.
If you're on the hunt for the slightly cheaper Macbook Air, see our deals guide here .
Top 8 MacBook Pro deals right now: MacBook Pro 13.3" 4GB RAM 500GB Flash , £739.99 on eBay
MacBook Pro 13.3'' with retina display 4GB RAM 128GB Flash , £740.00 at Ratuten.co.uk
MacBook Pro 13.3'' 4GB RAM, 500GB Flash , £779.99 at Amazon
Apple MacBook Pro 13.3'' 4GB RAM, 500GB Flash , £799.00 at Zavvi.com
Apple Macbook Pro 11.6'' 8GB RAM 256GB Flash , £839.95 at Simplyelectronics.net
MacBook Pro 11.6" 8GB RAM, 128GB Flash , £859.99 at Amazon
MacBook Pro 13.3'' 8GB RAM, 128GB Flash , £867.00 on Amazon
Apple MacBook Pro, 13.3'' 4GB RAM, 500GB Flash , £899 via John Lewis
Is it safe to buy refurbished? The most popular online retailers for secondhand and refurbished Macbooks are Amazon and eBay .
On eBay you can buy on auction or as a 'buy it now' item. There's no manufacturer warranty, but you are protected through eBay's protection policy for up to 30-days.
If you want peace of mind, and a warranty, there's an Argos Outlet on eBay which stocks Apple products.
eBay also has a Refurbished MacBooks section , where Apple netbooks regularly go for around £300+.
The Currys PC World clearance and refurbished online store is also a good place to start when hunting for a cheap Apple product.
Apple's online refurbished outlet is one of the most trusted places to buy second-hand, and prices can be as low as £629.
How much can I save through buying refurbished? This depends on the format of the sale. Is the item refurbished, used, secondhand, or ex-display?
If the item is purchased on auction or second-hand, there's no limit on the amount you can save, however, if the item is purchased as a 'refurbished' device, in other words, manufacturer checked, you're likely to save around £100.
As it's classed as almost new, the savings can be quite small.
Where can I sell my old MacBook Pro for cash? If you're looking to shift your current laptop, the following sites will pay to buy your device off you:
eBay - around £800 on auction
Music Magpie - prices vary from £32.42 - £213
Amazon - £800-£1,200
Gumtree - £450 +
How can I spot the sales before everyone else? Forum websites like Voucherbox are great for keeping an eye on deals. The Apple store occasionally hosts offers, buy you'll have to be quick, as they sell out in minutes.
Keep an eye on our Tech Deals page for all the latest sales gossip. If you want to get your hands on the Apple iPad, see our guide here .
